page.title: 06Mr.Fenwick
page.content: At the top of Deerings Road,at the end of Hillmorton Green,there is some land and on it is a horse trough. It is inscribed with the words "In Memory of George Anthony Fenwick 1912". He was a London banker who came to live in Hillmorton. His house was called "The Croft".He had a lot of servants inside the house and outside in the stables.Mr.Fenwick liked hunting and had sixteen hunters in his stables.His wife and two daughters also liked riding. He had many trees planted on the village green.Fenwick Drive,which is named after him,is built on the site of his garden and stables. Although he has been dead for many years,the trees and horse trough help us to remember him.
